item.title: 亚洲股市延续创纪录涨势，而石油和美元却在漂移
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市延续了创纪录的攀升势头，接过了华尔街的接力棒，石油公司和金融股的涨势帮助道琼斯工业平均指数创下历史新高。【原文：Asian stocks extended their record climb on Tuesday, taking the baton from Wall Street where gains for oil companies and financials helped the Dow Jones Industrial Average hit an all-time peak.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉产量增加，供应前景充裕，石油价格下跌
item.description: 周二，油价下跌，因为交易商权衡了美国抓捕尼古拉斯-马杜罗总统后委内瑞拉原油产量增加的前景，从而增加了在需求疲软的情况下今年全球供应充足的预期。【原文：Oil prices fell on Tuesday as traders weighed the prospect of higher Venezuelan crude output following the U.S. capture of President Nicolas Maduro, adding to expectations of ample global supply this year amid weak demand.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮刺激芯片价格上涨，三星第四季度利润可能大增 160
item.description: 由于客户争相满足对人工智能的蓬勃需求，芯片严重短缺导致内存价格大幅上涨，三星电子第四季度营业利润预计将大幅增长 160%。【原文：Samsung Electronics is expected to flag a 160% jump in its fourth-quarter operating profit spurred by a severe chip shortage that has sharply driven up memory prices as customers scramble to meet booming demand for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉担忧减弱，风险情绪升温，美元企稳
item.description: 周二亚洲交易开始后，美元在两周高点附近企稳，原因是美国在委内瑞拉采取军事行动引发的市场恐慌情绪有所缓解，美联储官员的鸽派言论刺激了华尔街的冒险行为。【原文：The U.S. dollar steadied near a two-week high as trading commenced in Asia on Tuesday, as market jitters from U.S. military action in Venezuela eased and dovish comments from Fed officials spurred risk-taking on Wall Street.】

item.title: Australia's BlueScope hits 17-year high on $8.8 billion buyout bid from SGH, Steel Dynamics
item.description: 由媒体亿万富翁凯瑞-斯托克斯（Kerry Stokes）领导的澳大利亚企业集团 SGH 出价 131.5 亿澳元（88.3 亿美元）收购博思格公司（BlueScope），旨在扩大其工业版图，并将这家钢铁制造商的股价推至 17 年来的最高点。【原文：Australian conglomerate SGH , led by media billionaire Kerry Stokes, has made a A$13.15 billion ($8.83 billion) bid for BlueScope , aiming to broaden its industrial footprint and pushing the steelmaker's shares to a 17-year high.】

item.title: 数据显示，随着竞争白热化，特斯拉 12 月英国汽车销量下滑 29
item.description: 周二的行业数据显示，特斯拉 12 月份在英国的汽车注册量同比下降了 29% 以上，凸显了这家美国电动汽车制造商在其最大的欧洲市场所面临的激烈竞争。【原文：Tesla's UK car registrations dropped by more than 29% year-on-year in December, industry data showed on Tuesday, underscoring the intense competition faced by the U.S. electric vehicle maker in its largest European market.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯将为美国城市道路提供自动驾驶技术
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）周一表示，该公司将于今年晚些时候在美国推出一款新的高级驾驶辅助系统，让其车辆在驾驶员的监督下在城市道路上自动行驶。【原文：Mercedes-Benz said on Monday it will launch a new advanced driver-assistance system in the United States later this year that lets its vehicles operate autonomously on city streets under driver supervision.】

item.title: Lucid、Nuro、Uber 首次推出机器人出租车，预计今年投放市场
item.description: Lucid Group、Nuro 和 Uber 周一发布了具有量产意向的机器人出租车，标志着自动驾驶汽车合作伙伴关系向商业部署迈出了关键一步。【原文：Lucid Group , Nuro and Uber on Monday unveiled a production-intent robotaxi, marking a key step toward commercial deployment for the autonomous vehicle partnership.】

item.title: 戴尔重振 XPS 品牌，推出新款笔记本电脑，提升个人电脑市场份额
item.description: 戴尔（Dell）在退出高端品牌 XPS 一年后，又重新推出了广受欢迎的 XPS 笔记本电脑产品线，希望借此在低迷的个人电脑市场上拉动需求。【原文：Dell has brought back its popular XPS laptop lineup a year after retiring the premium brand, as it looks to drum up demand in a sagging personal computer market.】

item.title: 比特币囤积者战略公司公布第四季度未实现亏损 174.4 亿美元
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的 "战略 "公司在第四季度出现了 174.4 亿美元的数字资产未实现亏损，这与该公司加密货币储备价值的下降有关。【原文：Michael Saylor's Strategy had a $17.44 billion unrealized loss on digital assets in the fourth quarter tied to a decline in the value of the company's cryptocurrency stockpile.】

item.title: 神秘商人因马杜罗被捕而获得 40 多万美元意外之财
item.description: 一位不知名的交易商在押注委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗将被赶下台后，获得了价值约 41 万美元的利润。【原文：An unknown trader has raked in a profit worth about $410,000 after betting that Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro would be ousted from his position.】

item.title: 交易日：新的一年，同样的风险偏好
item.description: 世界股市周一创下新高，因为投资者对美国抓捕委内瑞拉总统马杜罗并表示将暂时控制该国的说法不以为然，能源股大涨，另一波人工智能和科技股的乐观情绪也起到了补充作用。【原文：World stocks hit new highs on Monday as investors shrugged off the U.S. capturing Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and saying it will take temporary control of the country, with a surge in energy stocks complemented by another wave of AI and tech optimism.】

item.title: 由于预订情况强劲，Microchip Technology 上调第三季度收入预期
item.description: 受惠于终端市场复苏和强劲的预订量，微芯科技周一上调了对第三季度净销售额的预期，股价在盘后交易中上涨了 5.6%。【原文：Microchip Technology raised its expectations for third-quarter net sales on Monday, helped by recovery across end markets and strong bookings, sending shares up 5.6% in after-hours trading.】

item.title: 电力需求激增，Vistra 拟以 47 亿美元收购 Cogentrix 能源公司
item.description: 公用事业公司 Vistra 周一表示，该公司已同意以约 47 亿美元的价格从 Quantum Capital Group 手中收购 Cogentrix Energy，后者由 10 家天然气发电厂组成，以满足日益增长的电力需求。【原文：Utility Vistra said on Monday it has agreed to buy Cogentrix Energy, comprising 10 natural gas-fired power plants, from Quantum Capital Group for about $4.7 billion, as it looks to meet growing power demand.】

item.title: 美国授予 RTX 和 Indra 空中交通管制雷达合同
item.description: 美国交通部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）在周一的一份声明中说，美国已将新的空中交通管制雷达系统合同授予 RTX 公司和西班牙 Indra Sistemas 公司。【原文：The United States has awarded contracts for new air traffic control radar systems to RTX Corp and Spanish firm Indra Sistemas , Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 现代汽车集团计划从 2028 年起在美国工厂部署仿人机器人
item.description: 韩国现代汽车集团（Hyundai Motor Group）表示，该公司计划从 2028 年开始在其位于佐治亚州的美国制造工厂部署仿人机器人，这标志着该公司向高风险和重复性制造任务的自动化迈出了一步。【原文：Hyundai Motor Group plans to deploy humanoid robots at its U.S. manufacturing plant in Georgia starting in 2028, marking a step toward automating higher-risk and repetitive manufacturing tasks, the South Korean company said.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定亚马逊必须面对价格欺诈诉讼
item.description: 一名美国法官周一驳回了亚马逊公司要求驳回指控该在线零售商在 COVID-19 大流行期间哄抬价格的诉讼。【原文：A U.S. judge on Monday rejected Amazon.com's bid to dismiss a lawsuit accusing the online retailer of price gouging during the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 数字银行 PicPay 申请在美国上市
item.description: 巴西数字银行 PicPay 周一在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Brazilian digital bank PicPay filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Monday.】

item.title: 英特尔有望在拉斯维加斯 CES 上推出下一代 PC 芯片
item.description: 英特尔将于下周一在拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 展会上发布其用于笔记本电脑的新型人工智能芯片 Panther Lake，该公司正试图向投资者保证，其首款产品将采用名为 18A 的下一代制造工艺。【原文：Intel is set to launch Panther Lake, its new AI chip for laptops, on Monday at the CES trade show in Las Vegas, as the company seeks to reassure investors about the first product made using its next-generation manufacturing process called 18A.】

item.title: 巴西法官考虑在 Banco Master 案中阻止资产出售
item.description: 巴西联邦审计法院 TCU 的一名法官周一表示，他可能会考虑采取措施，防止在 Banco Master 清算过程中出售资产。【原文：A judge at Brazil's federal audit court TCU said on Monday that he may consider measures to prevent the sale of assets during the liquidation of Banco Master, a mid‑sized lender shut down by the Brazilian central bank in November after months of liquidity problems.】

item.title: 在承诺警告人工智能 "幻觉 "风险后，意大利结束了对 DeepSeek 的调查
item.description: 意大利反垄断机构结束了对中国人工智能系统 DeepSeek 的调查，原因是该系统被指未能警告用户它可能会产生虚假信息，并同意以有约束力的承诺作为结案条件。【原文：Italy’s antitrust authority has ended an investigation into the Chinese AI system DeepSeek for allegedly failing to warn users that it may produce false information, agreeing to binding commitments as a condition for closing the case.】

item.title: 三藩市联储研究表明，关税可能会降低通胀率
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行周一发表的研究报告称，特朗普政府去年大幅提高关税可能会降低而非提高通胀率，这表明降息可能是正确的应对政策。【原文：The sharp increase in tariffs imposed last year by the Trump administration may reduce inflation rather than increase it, according to research published Monday by the San Francisco Federal Reserve Bank, suggesting that interest-rate cuts may be the proper policy response.】

item.title: 竞争日趋激烈，英伟达公司首席执行官黄晓明将在拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 上发表演讲
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）首席执行官黄仁勋将于周一在拉斯维加斯消费电子展上发表演讲，可能会透露有关全球最有价值上市公司产品计划的新细节，因为该公司正面临着来自竞争对手和自身客户的日益激烈的竞争。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is set to give a speech on Monday at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, potentially revealing new details about product plans for the world's most valuable listed company as it faces increasing competition from both rivals and its own customers.】

item.title: 美国上周原油和产品库存可能增加
item.description: 路透社周一的初步民意调查显示，预计上周美国原油和产品库存将有所增加。【原文：U.S. crude oil and product stockpiles were expected to have risen last week, a preliminary Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: 创纪录的铜价预示着供应竞争将加速
item.description: 周一，铜价飙升至创纪录的每吨 13,000 美元以上，原因是人们担心会出现短缺，并预期委内瑞拉的动荡可能会加速争夺关键矿产的广泛竞争。【原文：Copper prices soared to records above $13,000 a metric ton on Monday, driven by fears of shortages and expectations turmoil in Venezuela could accelerate the broader race to secure critical minerals.】

item.title: 德国博世预计技术驱动型汽车市场将促进软件销售
item.description: 汽车供应商博世（ROBG.UL）周一在拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 展会上表示，由于汽车市场的技术驱动力日益增强，该德国公司预计未来几年的软件销售将十分强劲。【原文：Automotive supplier Bosch (ROBG.UL) expects strong software sales over the coming years thanks largely to an increasingly tech-driven car market, the German company said on Monday at the CES trade show in Las Vegas.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利认为失业率有可能 "突然 "走高
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联储主席尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周一表示，通胀正呈缓慢下降趋势，但失业率有可能 "突然 "走高。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve President Neel Kashkari on Monday said inflation is slowly trending down, but there is a risk the jobless rate could "pop" higher.】

item.title: 桥水公司创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）说，人工智能热潮正处于早期泡沫阶段
item.description: 对冲基金经理雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）周一在社交媒体平台 X 上发文警告说，推动华尔街科技股发展的人工智能热潮 "现在正处于泡沫的早期阶段"。【原文：The artificial intelligence boom that powered Wall Street's technology stocks is "now in the early stages of a bubble," hedge fund manager Ray Dalio warned in a post on social media platform X on Monday.】

item.title: 马杜罗被抓后，国际石油公司在委内瑞拉的状况如何？
item.description: 委内瑞拉是世界上石油储量最大的国家，由于总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗被美军逮捕而陷入危机。【原文：Here are key facts about international oil companies in Venezuela, a country with the world's largest oil reserves thrown into crisis by the capture of President Nicolas Maduro by U.S. forces.】

item.title: 摩根大通推出面向长期客户的咨询服务部门
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）周一表示，该公司成立了一个新的咨询部门，为特定客户群提供服务，并拓宽他们获取传统交易和融资之外的专业知识的渠道。【原文：J.P. Morgan said on Monday it launched a new advisory unit to serve a select group of clients and widen their access to expertise beyond traditional dealmaking and financing.】
